title: Charge asymmetry in the Heisenberg model
abstract:
Supplementing the Heisenberg model with a Hubbard-commuting kinetic of
electrons adds to its spectrum without interference. One consequence is the
precise incorporation of canonical linear spin wave theory within the
time-dependent Hartree-Fock framework, as pure localization emerges from
itinerant dynamics. This embedding method generalizes to all spin-1/2 models
and is expected to extend to multi-orbital systems. Away from half-filling,
differential tuning of doublon and holon motion imparts asymmetry to ordering
and fluctuations. This suggests that, in effective electronic theories, kinetic
interaction couplings are as significant as underlying band parameters when
modeling asymmetric phenomena near the Mott insulator.
